byline.contributor: Jon Hurdle reported from Philadelphia, and Daniel E. Slotnik from New York. Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By JON HURDLE and DANIEL E. SLOTNIK

abstract: Amtrak officials move to restore train service in Northeast Corridor in wake of passenger train derailment in Philadelphia that killed eight people and injured over 200; memorial service is held near curve in tracks where accident occurred.
lead_paragraph: The memorial took place near a curve in the tracks where a New York-bound passenger train derailed, killing eight and injuring over 200.

headline.print_headline: Train Service to Resume; Victims Are Remembered

snippet: The memorial took place near a curve in the tracks where a New York-bound passenger train derailed, killing eight and injuring over 200.
